conclusion: To solve this puzzle, we need to trace the paths of the liquids from points A, B, C, and D as they flow through the system and determine which containers (E, F, G, or H) they end up in.
A is green, B is yellow, C is orange, and D is pink.
The green liquid from A flows down along the green path, passing through the first baffle directly below A.
The green liquid continues straight down and reaches container E.
The yellow liquid from B flows down along the yellow path, passing through the first baffle directly below B.
The yellow liquid hits the horizontal white baffle and is redirected to the left.
The yellow liquid continues to flow left and reaches container F.
The orange liquid from C flows down along the orange path, passing through the first baffle directly below C.
The orange liquid hits the horizontal white baffle and is redirected to the right.
The orange liquid continues to flow right and reaches container G.
The pink liquid from D flows down along the pink path, passing through the first baffle directly below D.
The pink liquid hits the brown baffle and is redirected to the right.
The pink liquid continues to flow right and reaches container H.
A (green) flows into E, B (yellow) flows into F, C (orange) flows into G, and D (pink) flows into H.
